STATE OF MICHIGAN

GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 27, 2021
James Perlaki
Traverse Place
512 S. Grand Traverse
Flint, MI 48502
RE: License #: CB250201474
Traverse Place
512 S. Grand Traverse
Flint, MI 48502
Dear Mr. Perlaki:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 22, 2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement
Agreement MISEP requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
This agency is not a contracted agency with MDHHS
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 400.12418
Development of service plans.
(2, a) An agency shall complete an initial service plan within 30
days.
(b) An Updated service plan within 120 days after the initial and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
(6) Service plans shall be signed by the social services worker
and the social services supervisor.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
the social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
R400.12511(1)(a - d) & (2)(a-d) Termination:
 It was discussed with the agency to document all the youth’s information
under this rule including new location and proof the youth was provided
with all of his or her funds and personal property.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for their renewal report dated October
21, 2020. The corrective action plan was dated 10/30/2020. The agency was in
violation of the following rules:
R400.12507 – Medical/dental and mental health
R400.12509 – Independent Living record
R400.12510 – Independent Living contract
The agency made significant progress related to its corrective plan as there was no
repeat violations.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that Traverse Place continue on a regular license.
12/27/2021

Pinkey Brown Date
